intro: Clidemia acutiflora, commonly known as the sharpflower or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, silky hairs. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Clidemia acutiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
